intro: Cogswellia robustior, commonly known as the robust cogswellia, is a rare and striking member of the Aizoaceae family, native to the arid regions of Namibia. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems that store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces vibrant, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late summer. Its leaves are small, spiny, and often covered in a fine, white coating that helps reduce water loss. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is highly sought after by collectors and requires specific care to thrive in cultivation.
